text: So excited that The Wine Market is finally open! We went in this evening and enjoyed several different glasses of wine, a delicious slice of strawberry cake, and split a charcuterie board with various cheeses and meats. The staff was very kind, especially the manager (Kalynn) who came by to check on each table. She was extremely knowledgeable about their selection and gave great recommendations! I’ll definitely be back soon!

resp.text: Chelsea, thank you so much for your feedback and kind words! We really appreciate it and are so grateful for your support! We cannot wait to see you again soon!

The staff works extremely hard at paying attention to the wants and needs of their customers. The setting is perfect. The atmosphere compliments the products and environment that they are promoting. Perfect place for a date night. Whether, you are waiting to be seated for dinner at a restaurant in the nearby, downtown area; Or, perhaps, you have just finished a dinner and you’re not looking for a place too loud or full of college students this is THE GO TO WINE BAR in Tuscaloosa, AL.

resp.text: Victor, thank you so much for your positive feedback! We are grateful for your support, and are glad you have enjoyed your experiences at The Wine Market! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Anne Martin
text:
This Wine boutique is a great addition to Pour Baby. The boutique/ gift shop is a very welcoming space, bright and open.

I arrived with ideas to purchase but the customer service was limited. After more than few minutes, someone asked if I needed assistance and unfortunately, it was a bit rushed. They were working with another customer when they asked.

I wandered around the store, I think, about 10 - 15 minutes. I didn't have a lot of time, so I wasn't able to wait until they finished with the other customer.  There was only one person available for customer service, but it looked as though they were preparing for an event, I saw tables outside and the door was open when I arrived.

There's an array of wines, gourmet food and truffles just to name a few reasons to check this place out. I had my eye on a couple of things so I'll definitely be back when I have time to linger and browse.

I didn't have an opportunity to ask about the wine tastings or the personal consults for gift baskets because of the limited service. It's easy enough to check their website for the classes and there's plenty of time to check back for basket ideas.

It's a great place to get gifts for family, friends or co-workers.

I would definitely recommend one of Scott's classes to anyone wanting a fun and laid-back wine tasting experience!

name: John white
text:
Wow. another place I haven't given a review for!!

Calera package store and I go way back.  Well, not really...but I popped into this location BEFORE I decided to move here.  We were scouting the area and I was intrigued by the idea of a wine boutique.  There was nothing like that available in Calera.  Shocker, right??  Any who, moving on....

Calera package store offers a variety of wines that you may or may not find in grocery stores. Today I bought two wines for my girl friend.  She walked in and they were sitting there waiting for her.  I recently bought a wine captain (not a fridge...totally different) and I need to fill it with wines that I can save and wine that I can drink. I bought one wine that she can keep for years and I bought another that she could save but lets be honest...she probably won't.
Good selection...great customer service and perfect for what I'm looking for to feed my  new found love of collecting wines!

name: subb simm
text:
Okay so this may be premature - but I'm a huge customer service geek and I just popped into the place for the first time today. I needed to pick up a nice bottle of Champagne for a friend's birthday, and maybe a bottle or two for myself for the celebration. The man working helped me immediately, and when I told him what I was looking for, he was able to very quickly recommend two fantastic bottles both to suit my price point. He gave me a quick briefing on each bottle along with the prices, with which I was pleased!

As I was checking out, he took that time to explain to me how the place works. In addition to a great selection of wine, they also have very good service. One thing that the man mentions was that the wines in this store are guaranteed to be the lowest prices in the area, so my ear immediately perked up.

name: Luan Brashaw
text: I have recently moved to the area and Publix is a brand that is familiar and trusted. Publix at The Bray is like all Publix, friendly, polite team members waiting to help with a smile. This fairly new store offers all the same grocery brands and deals as my "old" Publix. I was delighted to find a self-serve hot bar and salad bar in addition to their deli. I believe they even have a seating area upstairs.  All employees were masked which is becoming more unusual since the COVID vaccine has become more available to the general public. Well-lit, amply spaced aisles add to the overall pleasant shopping experience. I look forward to frequenting this store AND the shopping complex it is a part of while I live in this area.

name: J L
text: I have had one too many disappointing events at this location. Twice I had to complain about the deli. Once the employees were not wearing gloves the second time I was given raw food. This time I went to get batteries. There was a 25% off coupon on the hangers for the batteries. All the Duracell brand. 4 pack 8 pack so forth. I get to the register with my 4 pack and they ring up normal price. I ask about. A young lady goes and checks then comes back and tells me it only for the bigger packs. Then why is it on all the pack sizes? They must of run out of room is what I am told. The cashier was very nice, apologetic but the other lady although not rude was not willing to solve the issue but was insistent on me paying full price. Needless to say although I would normally just pay decided not too and left. This was not a customer mistake but store level which should of been handled better.

name: chris walker
text: Customer service always great at this location. The fruit is always the best selection of fruit around. Prices are a we bit high but the customer service and the selection of fruit and fresh seafood is worth it.

name: Susan H
text: Everyone in this store is super friendly, clean and the employees have gone out fo there way to make sure they have a great selection like even special ordered products my other Publix had in another state. (with the exception of the pharmacy person but there’s always one right?!) Overall awesome store!

name: Hanna Brown
text: Brandon and Trent were outstanding! They took the time to guide us through their current favorites, what inspired them to start Golden Age, and they fashioned us the most incredible charcuterie board (genuinely, from France to New York, this charcuterie board tops all). Their shelves are lined with harder-to-find, natural, intentional wines, and their quality is the best we’ve found in Alabama. WE WILL RETURN & RECOMMEND!

resp.text: Thank you so much for making the trip to visit us and for the kind words! It was a pleasure meeting you and good luck with WSET, you’ll crush.

name: Kent Still
text: Golden Age is by far the best specialty bottle shop I've seen. We drove hours to Mountain Brook and were not let down. The 50/50 board was amazing, and the wine recommendations were even better. We will definitely be regular customers and will continue to make the drive for the experience.

resp.text: Thanks so much for visiting us! It was our pleasure. Cheers!

name: Amy Stone
text: Golden age is one of my absolute favorite places in Birmingham. Incredible wine selection in lots of price points. The staff is friendly and helpful—the wines they’ve recommended have quickly become favorites. I love that the staff can help you no matter your level of knowledge on wine. I also love that I can place an order online and they’ll bring the wine to my car. It’s a beautiful space with delicious wine and great people.

name: sandra bowman
text: I love golden age! The space is aesthetically so beautiful. The staff is friendly and always sharing knowledge about the wine that I really love. Learning about wine feels overwhelming so I appreciate how they try to educate their customers also.

name: Brad Lugar
text: Okay, been in bham for a long time. This is place is a nice escape and the vibe here is chill. Definitely coming back.

name: Shelley Coskery
text: Best wine selection in town. Perfect for picking up a bottle and taking home or enjoying a date night out. Love their special events, dinner nights and tastings.

name: Kathleen Buccleugh
text:
The selection at Golden Age is amazing. This shop is THE reason I started to branch out and try new varietals. They have an excellent selection of Austrian and German wines. I highly recommend doing an online order for easy and safe pickup. You can even get some of their pantry (Red Mountain Honey 🤤) and merch (stemware, cheese boards) items online.

If you don't know what type of wine you're looking for, they'll help you out in a heartbeat. And be sure to have a cheese/charcuterie platter in the wine garden. With the Clothbound Cheddar, for sure!!

name: Jordan Van Horn
text: Great wine and even better people. Can’t recommend Golden Age enough.

name: Tim Webb
text:
Great selections, attentive staff and great atmosphere. Would be the perfect place with exception of fact they charged us a $20 corkage fee on a $66 bottle of wine. 2 establishments  within 2 miles of Golden Age gladly serve you their wine without a corkage fee and their prices are as good as or better than Golden Age.
I would like to host my weekly wine group here but they would never go For this corkage fee. We can buy a nice bottle of wine for what the corkage fee cost.
They could greatly increase traffic by doing away with the corkage fee!

resp.text:
Hi Tim,
Thank you for your feedback. We are a new business and every review counts. We are unique in the fact that we have an incredible selection of over 700 wines and also a well-designed wine bar with attentive staff and a great atmosphere. We feel that having pricing on-par and often lower than other wine shops in town makes us a great resource to be able to discover new wines. Apologies if we did not explain the corkage fee, that is on us and we have emailed you a more detailed response.

name: George M. Wolfe
text: Excellent and curated selection of mostly imported wines including some very unusual ones.  The owner is very knowledgeable and also has a great selection of cheese and charcuterie.

name: Hannah Lonsdale
text: The wines are interesting, the staff are nice, but OMG the smell of sewage in the outdoor seating area 🤢🤢🤢

resp.text: Hi Hannah, the city had an issue with the sewer lines that has been resolved. Now the only thing sick here are the wines 🤙🏻

name: Alexandra Smith
text: What a beautiful place. Great prices. Friendly faces. Spectacular wine.

name: Connor Coskery
text: Best wine shop you will find!

name: Kaitlin Slattery
text: The BEST wine selection in all of Birmingham. Alan and I have tried about 6 different bottles over the past few months based off staff recommendations and each one was perfect. A personal favorite, the Gaspard Rosé, who’s description is as follows: the taste of sunshine and the color of sunlight through a window after the rain✨I cannot wait to have a moment free of children to experience a date night at their beautiful bar instead of just swinging by to bring a bottle home! Á votre santé 🍷

name: Danyell
text: Friendly staff, great selection.

resp.text: Thank you for coming out! Cheers, Brandon and Trent

name: M Davis
text: This is my favorite spot in Mountain Brook. Truly the most beautiful space and owned by the best people. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Shopping for wine can be overwhelming if you're not an expert, but Golden Age is super accessible. I love that the wines are low intervention + natural and also affordable. Get a glass of wine + charcuterie board with a friend after work or meet your clients for a drink.. it's the perfect place!

name: Kelsey
text: This is a lovely facility. The staff are attentive. They have large selections. I only met a group here and don't drink wine or alcohol really so I cannot provide much insight.

name: Shella Sylla
text: Excellent wine selection. Super knowledgeable & friendly staff!

name: Mia Peterson
text: I had a wonderful first experience at Golden Age! The vibes were great and the atheistic is pleasing. But their staff is where they shine. Alex joyfully answered my 10,000 questions and had great recommendations. I thoroughly enjoyed my time and will be back.

name: Evan Beattie
text: Great staff. Very helpful. Also accommodated our group in ways they didn't need to. Awesome selection of wine. Awesome atmosphere.

name: Mel B
text:
Excellent wine selection for purchase.
After purchasing several bottles, fiancé and I opted to stay for a glass of wine. Bartender wasn’t overly friendly. (He did not introduce himself.) He didn’t offer a customary,” taste,” before pouring and didn’t bother to ask if we were satisfied with our choice.  Although we don’t expect an animated conversation, we did not feel appreciated as customers.
Another, older couple sitting at a nearby table were treated very differently. From their interactions it appeared he knew them. They sampled a few different wines before being given generous pours.
We observed that the charcuterie board portions were rather small for the price so we passed on the food.
May go back to buy bottles of wine but unfortunately will not be staying to drink or dine.

resp.text:
Hi Mel,
I'm really glad you loved the wine selection! We look forward to seeing you back in the shop soon. I realize that you felt overlooked while spending time with us and we apologize for that. We appreciate your feedback and as a new business we are always looking for ways to provide excellent service.

name: Jim Davis
text: Thoughtful organic wine selection is just the beginning of the vision for this elegant gem. Thanks for the wonderful service we received on our recent visit.  We will be back!

name: Jimmy Truong
text:
Words can’t begin to describe how much I love Golden Age. From the design to the service, they knock it out of the park each time.

The space is a clean and minimal with a huge emphasis on the bar and of course, their huge selection of wine. The bartenders are extremely knowledgeable and insanely hospitable. And if you’re looking for some wine to-go, they have something for everyone at every price point.
That’s another thing I want to talk about. Their prices are more than fair and incredibly approachable. Having traveled to many wine bars from all over the country, this place is the best. Whether you’re searching for a simple wine or trying to venture out to try a funky wine, this place is a can’t miss.

name: Trey Miller
text: Cool place. Good wine. But there is a $20 cork fee when you buy their wine to drink at their restaurant. Just be aware. It was a strange surprise to us

resp.text: Hey Trey! Thanks for coming in and taking time to leave a review. All of our retail wine is priced at retail prices, not restaurant prices. If you buy a bottle at a restaurant it is about 3x the price you pay at our place even with the corkage. Apologies if that wasn’t made clear to you by one of our staff. We would love to have you in again sometime. Cheers, Brandon

name: Robert Williams
text: The best wine bar I have ever been to, across 50 states.  Amazing.  And the owners are knowledgeable and very friendly.  Wines are the best I've ever tasted.

resp.text: Cheers! Great meeting you!

name: Perry Riddle
text: Excellent wine bar and retail shop specializing in natural wines. Golden Age has filled a void in Birmingham. The owners are great guys and very knowledgeable, and the staff is super friendly and helpful.

name: Katie Herron
text: One of a kind atmosphere, incredible selections you can’t get anywhere else, and the staff is very knowledgeable. 5 stars all the way!

name: Genece Bonner
text: The owners are great and very knowledgeable. Great experience.

name: Richard Haberstroh
text: By the glass or bottle. Hands down the best place to pick out a bottle of wine for home and know you will enjoy it! Life is too short for bad wine!

resp.text: Thanks Richard! We are so grateful to be your wine shop!

name: Nathan English
text: Great wine shop and bar. The owner's are nice and knowledgeable. The prices seem very reasonable.

resp.text: Thanks Nathan! We appreciate your business. Our prices are straight retail- the same or even cheaper as some of the grocery stores in town.

name: Craig Stilley
text: Purchasing wine can oftentimes be a frustrating, confusing, and expensive venture. I find myself staring in the wine aisle for 30 minutes reading reviews attempting to make a perfect choice. Brandon and Trent, and the rest of the staff at Golden Age, easily bring things to the ground level for those of us who lack in our wine proficiency. They never upsell you unless it fits what you are looking for. The space is beautifully designed, the service is excellent, and seriously the best prices for the best selection of wine you can find in town. So if you want to buy wine as gift and know nothing about wine, or if you want nerd out with some passionate people about an amazing Grenache, or just grab a couple glasses with your babe and enjoy some charcuterie, THIS IS YOUR SPOT!

name: Kyle Carpenter
text: Great knowledgeable staff! Birmingham’s best place for natural wines!

name: Xanna Griffin
text: Friends joke that if I am not at home or work, I must be at Golden Age. Love the selection, staff, design, and their tasting events. Support your neighborhood wine shop!

name: Craig Brewton
text: Owners are very amenable. A little pricey....but it is in MB.

name: Will Browning
text: The service is good, but every single item is up charged by at least $10, if not $20 or even more. A 750 mL bottle of Maker’s Mark cost me over $50 which is absolutely ridiculous for something usually found in the upper $30’s. 750 mL normal Woodford reserve is $56 whereas it can be found in the mid to upper $30s at other stores in Birmingham as well. It is probably a result of where it is located in Mountain Brook that they raise the prices that much. I am assuming that the people who have left all of these positive reviews have enough money to not worry about the up-charge, but this review is for those of us who don’t. You may get superior service and selection here, but you also will most certainly get ripped off. I would suggest just going to your average ABC store around Birmingham instead for a good enough selection at a much lower price.

name: Cheslyn Wilson
text: James is the best shop keeper ever. hes very knowledgeable and laid back. Always willing to show you around and help you find the perfect elixir to get you set.

resp.text: Thank you, Cheslyn!

text: Had a great experience, even though we couldn't get a full tour because of covid the store clerk did a great job showing us some great wines and made great suggestions. The store may be a little more expensive (a couple of dollars more, no big deal) I would be back for the atmosphere and the knowledge of the clerk that helped us.

resp.text: Hey Kyle! We've been making due with this situation and glad that our concierge service treated you right. We're gonna stay the course for a little bit longer, but hopefully we'll be having a glass together soon. Thanks again for all the support!

name: Caroline Weber
text: WAYYYYYY overpriced. Do not waste your money here. I paid over 2x the amount for a bottle of Tito’s. Very disappointed.

resp.text: HI there! Being an independent shop, we have to buy our liquor from the ABC and then apply a mark-up -- which I can assure isn't 50%... Unless somebody is *really* hooking you up. Our price is currently about $10 more than the ABC (Thanks Alabama!). Anyway, I think you'll find that our prices are more than reasonable when compared to other non-ABC shops in the area. On the flip-side, our wine (and beer!) prices keep us competitive with grocery stores and the like -- so you can always utilize our expertise in those areas. Besides, wine is good for you... Or so we hear.

text: The prices are well in line with the likes of Starbucks, etc. The location is excellent and we enjoyed the visit. text: Amazing cappuccino with foam, My friend loves the iced chai tea. Plenty of food options as well. If you visit go upstairs because there are several rooms even one with windows with a view of downtown and the courthouse. If you're lucky you can use the bluetooth speaker and play your own tunes(just don't get caught lol).

text: Our weekly home away from home.  Very enjoyable beverages and menu items.  Inviting atmosphere.  Sit long enough and sip enough beverages and you never know who you will run into.  Wonderful place to just enjoy the company of others.

name: Anna Parker
text: I've gone in this place 3 different times and 3 different times I've left without anything. The service is awful.  I've gone in waited 10 min without seeing anyone there working to take a. Order. Went in tonight and 2 workers were in the back prepping food while me and another customer waited 5 minutes for someone to take her order.  I eventually left because of how slow they were to even acknowledge us. I don't know how this place stays open. I'm hoping a decent coffee shop will open at the downtown square because Huntsville can use one

resp.text:
Anna,

This is from Cathy. one of the owners of A Cup Of Everything.

Thank you so much for letting us know about this. I will be discussing this with our managers. We work hard to offer great customer service and apologize for for your experience..

Cathy

text: Didn't try the coffee, but the pastries were top notch, as was the service. You can go into the cosy rooms upstairs and stay for hours; I went to find a quiet place to do some writing, and felt welcome every time. Absolutely delightful. 5/5

text: I go to A Cup of Everything at least once a week. I just love there freshly brewed coffee. The WiFi is  excellent for studying on some school work. I highly suggest the coffee!

resp.text: Zachary, we hate to hear that your smoothie wasn't good. Can we make you another to hopefully redeem ourselves?

text: Expensive coffee with mediocre service. I paid almost five bucks for a small  black coffee and a shot of espresso. I've been there a few times, only really if I have to use the bathroom downtown early in the day. Never heard them once say "welcome to cup of everything", or "thanks for stopping by sir!". Just seems like the staff is generally upset to be there.

resp.text:
Mr. LukiPooki

I am one of the owners of A Cup of Everything. I am very sorry you hear that you have has such poor service at ACoE. Please know that we appreciate yours and all our customer's business. If you like I eill be happy to meet you at the shop and I will personally refund you your money.

Regards
Cathy Lamberth
Clamberth@acupofeverything.com

name: Nicholas Thompson
text: It seems as though as this establishment cares more for speedy service rather than quality. The atmosphere is lackluster and the employees seem very disinterested in providing a quality experience that one would expect of a privately owned coffee shop.

name: Stormii L
text: Nice. Love to go sit upstairs on my lunch break.

name: Katheryn Young
text:
A Cup of Everything Convenience Store is truly convenient--a menu loaded with coffees, teas, and sandwiches primarily; and a medium-sized cache of snack bars, bottled and canned drinks, chips, and even things like headache medicine, this little restaurant/shop is a wonderful addition to the Square in downtown HSV. In addition to having just about anything you might find yourself needing while out on a stroll around downtown, or serving jury duty, etc., the staff is incredibly friendly and will (in my experience) go out of their way to ensure your good day.
However, you will be paying convenience store prices for most of their selections: a cup of coffee will only leave you a little better off than a visit to Starbucks (without the carefully constructed flavor--ACoE's coffee has been particularly bitter in my experience, even with sugar and cream), and the food can get a little pricey as well. Packaged foods, on the other hand, seem to be a bit cheaper than, say, the store inside the courthouse but it's not really enough to keep me from driving the little extra distance to the Publix at Twickenham Square.
The cozy atmosphere and neat meeting space upstairs, though, may be enough to counter-balance the slightly higher prices and not-so-awesome coffee--and a warm Spring day sat outside with a cold cup of iced tea and a fresh-made sandwich can't quite be beat.
So all-in-all, if you don't mind spending a bit more and not getting Starbucks-quality coffee, you will get a cozy, unique atmosphere great for a refreshing time on your own or with friends.

name: CCV9
text: This is one of Tuscaloosa's gems. Amazing selection of wines that I challenge you to get anywhere else in the city. They do a great job of getting items you won't find at any of the local grocery stores. They also organize wine and dinner tastings with local restaurants as well as do wine classes for the public. Staff is wonderful, helpful, and extremely knowledgable. This place is perfect, whether you are looking for a $10 dollar bottle of wine, or if you are interested in a more sophisticated bottle to share with a date, they have a wide spectrum of wines to satisfy the casual drinkers as well as the snobs. Price points are generally from the low to mid teens to a little north of  $100 depending on what you are interested in, but regardless of what you buy, it is the best value in Tuscaloosa. And if you don't want to leave with a bottle, you are more than welcome to stay for a glass and enjoy the cozy atmosphere. It's one of my favorite places in town.

Dear valued customer,

We are very sorry for the confusion and the inconvenience we may have caused.

We double checked the price before and after sales. The 750ml bottle of Hornitos Plata you bought is priced at $37.99 and it is nowhere in the shelf implied otherwise.

In any case of mistaken overcharge, or under circumstances where our products don’t meet the expectations, we have in the past and will continue to offer refunds for our customers' 100% satisfaction. It does not appear to be so in this case. We are more than happy to clarify the issue, if you visit our store.

Again, please accept our apology.

Sunny’s Mgmt.

name: Liz Bozeman
text:
TRDL; if you don't want to read entire review:
if you need to go to a liquor store. DONT GO TO ABC OR ABC SPIRITS or whatever that place is called - thats on 231. I mean its good but so far NO liquor store has compared to this one. Just come here. TRUST. ME.

Full Review:
I just went here for the first time today. As in just left. I loved this place SO SO SO MUCH. I was telling myself I must do a review as soon as I get home. What this place has to offer is so much! I just bought soju from there! And it was not terribly price. The only place I could find it was at a Korean restaurant (that was called Kalim Garden. And I would buy unopened bottles from them. I also got 2 different bottles of sake. Which I couldn't be more happy about! There is White Claw here. They still have it in stock despite the fact that there is currently a shortage. The guy inside (I didn't get his name was so friendly. This is also a place you can get CBD & vape products. I actually bought a pack of prerolles hempettes. It looked like they have 4 brands to choose from. I have tried a lot of the hempette brands and listen to me!! - just buy the red pack. Stunna Bubba Kush. I have tried the other ones pure hemp is pretty good but there are a lot stems in it even tho they claim theres not, wild hemp brand is just...really tame. Flavor is worst than the "Pure Hemp" brand. So that's usually just what ive been forced to get around here. HOWEVER I am currently smoking one of these Stunnas. The flavor - very good. Would rate 4/5 bc its good but it is def no premium ish. Stem wise give a 3/5 I'm hearing tons of little pops.... But nothing like the Pure Hemp brand. Price I give 5/5 stars. This one was $13.99 I think. The other brands I have mentioned were $9.99. Which is typical but very decently priced compared to other hemp shops ive been to. So just pay the extra $4 for the red one if you are interested.

Also as for how the store looks and atmosphere wise - AMAZING. hate that google is a 5 star system bcuz that for sure is a 10 star - no 11 stars for the atmosphere of the place. Employee also seems to be very knowledgeable although I didnt have to ask many questions bc I knew what I was going for and know my alcohol. But they had things in there I have never tried before. So that excited me a lot.

I will be putting the TLDR at the top of my review as well in case no one reads this novella of a review. 😂 but if you need to go to a liquor store. DONT GO TO ABC OR ABC SPIRITS or whatever that place is called - thats on 231. I mean its good but so far NO liquor store has compared to this one. Just come here. TRUST. ME.

name: P Guice
text:
I love liquor express. They have the biggest and best selection of craft beer in town. There are plenty of small craft beer stores with great selection in the area but you can usually find something you haven't seen anywhere else in the area.

I can't say I've bought much liquor or wine here (Unless the advertise something on sale or something rare on social media) but they do have a very large selection of both.

They also have a craft beer and whiskey bar. Probably the most taps in town and they always have interesting stuff you can't get anywhere else on tap. It's hard to just pick a few! Also I've only ever dealt with nice bartenders and staff here.

Whether it's going and having a drink or picking up something to go, liquor express has got what you need.

name: Kris Gibson
text:
Definitely one of the best stores in North Alabama to beer shop at. Extensive selection both on tap and bottled/canned. A good go to for liquor if the ABC store is closed.

The staff can be hit or miss sometimes but almost all of my interactions and transactions here have been pleasant. Most of them will have really good recommendations if you just ask.

The hit or miss about the staff has to do with pricing. Three out of the last five times I've been in there a product rings up more at the register than what's indicated on the pricing sticker (both on the shelf and attached to the product itself). Once I found a single product with three different prices on the bottles. When brought to the staff's attention they've acted put out that I called them on the pricing issue. At this point I think this is a pretty consistent issue with this store. It's at worst defrauding people on purpose or at best laziness on the staff's part.

My only criticism is that they emphasize craft so much that there isn’t enough of the imports that are hard to find.

name: Essentially Shannon
text: This is not my first time going to liquor express, however it will be my last. I went into the store last night not realizing that my drunken neighbor works there. We've had words a few times about our dogs and especially if she gets drunk. It's my birthday haven't had time to drink been busy working. I spend at least 15 mins trying to decide what I want to drink and she never says a word to me. As I approach the counter she proceeds to say "I'm not coming home to another drunken fight about the dogs, plus you look intoxicated I'm not going to sell to you." I stand there for a second speechless because she is the one always drunk coming down to my house talking mess about nothing. I say to her really? Then I ask her for a number where I can reach someone in management. You can Google it I don't know it, is her response. I look on their Facebook page and see that a few other people have had to deal with the same thing. I thought a business' main goal was to make money.... apparently if she doesn't like you she will try to embarrass you and use the line I have the right to refuse service to anyone in the state. Thankfully Liquor Express isn't the only liquor store in Huntsville. I hate that I am only one person because if I could I would stop as much business from that store as possible. It's a shame because I have been going there for years...

name: Winston Smith
text: Shopped at the Publix at the Morgan Road Plaza on 6/1/2021 at about 5:30pm. From the deli, we bought sushi and "Quick Shrimp Bites". While the sushi was really pretty good, the shrimp bites is why there is a "1 star" rating. My wife and I ate in the parking lot. The shrimp was cold as were the potato wedges. I really cannot understand how a brand new, flagship, Publix  serves cold shrimp and potatoes that were supposed to be hot.

resp.text: Can you please reach out to our Customer Care line: 1-800-242-1227, or private message us on Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/publix/, and we will be happy to help get this concern addressed with the Store Manager. ➳Cinthya

text: For the most part I am satisfied with this Publix. Unfortunately I much prefer the deli down the road at Taylor Junction. Everyone working there knows exactly how to slice and present the deli meats and cheeses. You may not believe this but the smoothest parking lot is the one closest to me, Dalraida Commons. When I say smooth it doesn't mean it is not a little rough but it is the best! Now here is something some might not notice, I have never seen a filthy dirty trash can going into any of Montgomery's Publix. I thank whoever is keeping them clean!

name: Event Horizon
text: I like the store but stopped shopping there after a Very Bad experience with Produce and the attitude of the Produce Mgr. I picked up one, then a other and then another peach only to find they were Green&Fuzzy...gave up on the peaches and showed them to the produce mgr who just shrugged his shoulders like he didnt care at all. So I went to buy a bag of tangerines. Guess what, when I picked up the bag all the ones on tbe bottom were Green & Fuzzy too. I went back to the mgr and he rolled his eyes and said "what do you want? I check everyday...it happens". That level of rot does Not happen over night and his attitude was the worse. Publix customers Pay More and I dont mind for better quality and service. After 14 yrs shopping at Publix for my Family of 4, I quit and found out that I get quality produce and other things at Piggly Wiggly for half the cost and great service. That's approx $600/month of my money Publix has lost. This particular Publix is not in as affluent an area as the one I used to shopping for 14 years but I would hate to think that the lack of $$ is why the products and service are inferior

text:
Poor selction, claims they can't get products that every other Publix in Montgomery regularly stocks as well as local Wal Marts.
Claims the distributors can't get them. How does this publix have a different distributor than the others. Has one employee that will blatantly argue that you are wrong about what you  payed for an item as you are trying to show them on your receipt to prove to them "they" are wrong. Management just makes excuses for her. This has been this way for over 2 years. Corporate office simply contacts the store Manager and the cycle of excuses starts all over.
Do yourself a favor and visit any of the other Publix in Montgomery and stay away from this one!

3/6/2019

name: Frederick
text: I can't believe I'm actually going to say this. I walked into this store then stood at the counter and ask for help in locating Coco Lopez liqueur. The cashier was leaning back in his chair watching his laptop wearing his headphones. He ignored me. I repeated my question to him about the location of the Coco Lopez liqueur. He pointed in the direction far away from him and said "yes you can go look for it."   I realized that I did not know what I was looking for. I need help! He let out a gasp and slipped his bare feet into some very casual flip flops and slid out to the store with me. I must have said the name five or six times and finally he points to the bottom of the Shelf instructing me to pick up the bottle myself.  I informed him that I was not looking for Pepe Lopez tequila. I'm looking for Coco Lopez liquor.  I happened to see the other reviews below mine and they were all one star as well. And I think one star is three-quarters of a star too much.

text: Well, I have a lot to say about this specific location, most likely too much for this review so I'll just sum it up, I bought a bluetooth speaker (25 bucks) unboxed it and realized only one speaker (out of two) was working, so I decided to try and return it and exchange it for a different one, (mind you, this all happened within 5 hours and I had the receipt) after explaining to the manager what this speaker was not doing (working) she pointed at a sign behind me and said sorry we have a no return policy, I explained I just wanted to exchange it for a different one and I showed receipt, nonetheless, she refused to accept a broken product this store sold me, and said they had a no return policy on everything, so went to another location and with ease after explaining the situation, manager did the exchanged with no issues. So avoid this unprofessional hippocratic people at all cost, they try and screw you at any chance they get. I don't know the manager s name who refused to take back a broken product, but will be finding it and reporting it to corporate and others soon. She was a Hispanic or Chinese lady with glasses. Avoid this store at all costs.
